0.title: I think Ananya Panday dated 2 guys at same time: Karan Johar to Bhavana
0.article_body: On the show 'Koffee With Karan 7', Gauri Khan said that she would advise her daughter Suhana to not date two guys at the same time. Reacting to it, Karan Johar told Bhavana Pandey, "I think Ananya has already done that. She was oscillating." To this, Bhavana replied, "She was thinking of two, so she could break up with one."

1.title: Will use guerrilla tactics: Team Thackeray on denial of Dussehra rally venue
1.article_body: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, while responding to the Mumbai civic body's decision to deny them permission to hold a Dussehra rally, said that it was a "very bad script of the BJP". Sena leader Ajay Choudhari said that they will resort to "guerrilla warfare tactics" to hold their rally. Both Sena factions were denied permission to hold their rallies.

2.title: Toyota's Oct-Dec output likely to decline amid chip shortage
2.article_body: Toyota has said it expects to produce about 850,000 vehicles worldwide per month on average from October to December due to semiconductor shortages. Last month, Toyota said it aimed to produce about 900,000 vehicles per month on average from September to November. Toyota has not changed its global vehicle production target for current financial year, keeping it 9.7 million units.

3.title: 60-yr-old man kills wife, dies by suicide in Pune
3.article_body: A 60-year-old man reportedly died by suicide after killing his wife in Pune on Wednesday. "Preliminary investigation suggests...the husband strangled and hit the wife with a wooden stool leading to her death," police said. They also found a note, believed to have been written by the man, which points to a discord between the two over some personal issues.

4.title: 18-yr-old girl thrown into air after getting hit by car in B'luru; video surfaces
4.article_body: An 18-year-old woman was thrown into air after being hit by a car on Bengaluru's Bellari road. The incident happened when the woman and another person were trying to cross the road. The woman suffered severe injuries and is now being treated at Baptist Hospital. In March, a 14-year-old student was killed by a speeding truck on the same road.

5.title: Going to win Oscar: Chris Evans on Ana De Armas' Marilyn Monroe role in 'Blonde'
5.article_body: Chris Evans has said he predicted Oscar for Ana De Armas when she showed him a picture of herself as Marilyn Monroe from the screen test of Andrew Dominik directorial 'Blonde'. "I remember looking at it and saying...'You're going to win an Oscar for this'," Evans said. He said playing Monroe was Armas' one of the first "incredibly demanding" opportunities.

6.title: WhatsApp Pay India head Manesh Mahatme quits after 18 months: Report
6.article_body: WhatsApp's India payment business head Manesh Mahatme has reportedly quit the company after an 18-month stint. Going by his LinkedIn profile, he joined WhatsApp Pay in April 2021 and worked until September 2022. He is also said to be joining Amazon India. Before joining WhatsApp, Mahatme was a Director and board member of Amazon Pay India for nearly seven years.

7.title: Govt failed to protect, secure the nation on every front: Congress
7.article_body: Congress spokesperson Abhishek Manu Singhvi on Wednesday alleged that the central government has failed to protect and secure the country on every front, from national security to food security. He said the government is attempting to divert the attention of people from its "inefficiency" through ED raids. Singhvi added that incidents of crime against women are rising under BJP government.

8.title: Govt may allow joint IPs between foreign firms, Indian startups: MoS IT
8.article_body: Minister of State for Electronics and Information Technology, Rajeev Chandrasekhar, has said the Indian government is mulling over making provisions to create joint intellectual properties (IPs) between foreign companies and Indian startups. The ministry said it is working to create a space for artificial intelligence and deep-tech startups by providing them capital support and market access.

9.title: 25 shops in Thane develop cracks after railway work leads to road cave in
9.article_body: As many as 25 shops in Thane's Waghoba Nagar developed cracks on Thursday after a nearby road caved in, civic authorities said. No injuries were reported, the authorities added. The cracks developed due to digging work being undertaken near the tracks by the railways to construct a protection wall, Thane Municipal Corporation's Regional Disaster Management Cell Chief Avinash Sawant said.

10.title: Astounded by Saif's research for his role: 'Vikram Vedha' directors
10.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' directors Pushkar and Gayatri said they were "astounded" by the "rigorous research regimen" Saif Ali Khan followed to adapt an encounter specialist cop's persona. They said Saif's preparation to become Vikram also included practice with real weapons. "Saif's passion towards his craft is visible in his body language in the film," they added.

11.title: Pepperfry to file draft IPO documents in next quarter: Report
11.article_body: Furniture and home goods e-commerce firm Pepperfry will file draft papers for an Initial Public Offering (IPO) in the October-December quarter, as per a report. The company plans to list on the markets by next year. It has appointed JP Morgan and ICICI Bank to lead the IPO. Earlier this year, Pepperfry delayed its IPO owing to adverse markets.

12.title: 3 men looking for friend's address thrashed on suspicion of child-lifters in MP
12.article_body: Three men were thrashed by a group of people on suspicion of being child-lifters in MP's Bhopal on Tuesday. The men were looking for a friend's address when the incident took place. Some people called the police, who rushed to the spot and intervened to stop the attack. A case has been registered against the attackers.

13.title: Infosys shares fall to 16-month low as IT stocks face margin woes
13.article_body: Infosys Limited shares hit a 16-month low on Thursday and also fell to a 52-week low of ₹1,360 apiece, a level last seen on May 25, 2021. At 1:04 pm, it was trading at ₹1,369.95 a share, down 0.53% on the National Stock Exchange. This comes even as IT stocks are facing pressure amid margin worries and global economic uncertainties.

14.title: Let's make sure 'RRR' gets Oscars nomination: 'Don't Look Up' director
14.article_body: 'Don't Look Up' director Adam McKay said 'RRR' not being picked as India's official entry to Oscars 2023 is a "travesty". "But let's make sure it gets a Best Picture nomination [at Oscars]. Can we do a screening at the Rose Bowl? (How amazing would that be?)," he tweeted. Gujarati film 'Chhello Show' is India's official entry to the Oscars.

15.title: Traffic diversions to be in place at Delhi airport Terminal 1D from Monday
15.article_body: The Delhi airport authority announced traffic diversions at Delhi airport's Terminal 1D starting Monday due to ongoing expansion work. Vehicles coming to T1 departures will have to make a u-turn at the end of the forecourt ramp and exit through the newly widened up-ramp to take Mehram Nagar road, airport officials said.

16.title: Delhi Police bust int'l drug cartel, arrest 2 with drugs worth ₹60 cr
16.article_body: Delhi Police's Special Cell on Thursday busted an international narcotics cartel and arrested two key members of the group. The accused were arrested from Bihar's Muzaffarpur and have been identified as Abhishek Raja and Nizamuddin. The police have also seized 10 kilograms of heroin and 10 kilograms of opium, estimated to be worth more than ₹60 crore from the accused.

17.title: Zetwerk reports operating loss of ₹42 cr in FY22, revenue up 6 times
17.article_body: Business-to-business (B2B) unicorn startup Zetwerk reported an annual operating loss of ₹42 crore in FY22 as against a loss of ₹43 crore in the previous year. This was led by a rise in non-cash employee stock option plan expenses. The 2018-founded startup's operating revenue grew six times to ₹4,961 crore in FY22 as against ₹835 crore in the previous year.

18.title: Freedom of speech 'non-negotiable, uncompromising': VP Jagdeep Dhankhar
18.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Thursday said freedom of speech is a "non-negotiable and uncompromising" asset of India. "If we depart from this, we'll compromise with the sovereignty and wholesomeness of the country," Dhankhar added. He further stressed upon the role of intellectuals as very critical and urged them to engage in proactive dialogue, debate and discussion.

19.title: Man posing as PA to Congress MP dupes local of ₹2.50 lakh in Ludhiana
19.article_body: A man, posing as the personal assistant to Congress MP Ravneet Singh Bittu, allegedly duped a local resident of ₹2.50 lakh in Ludhiana, police said. The accused promised the victim a government job in the building branch of Ludhiana Municipal Corporation, police added. The accused allegedly demanded ₹2.50 lakh for the task, police further said.

20.title: Supreme Court extends stay on IHH's open offer for Fortis Healthcare
20.article_body: The Supreme Court extended a stay on IHH Healthcare's open offer for Fortis Healthcare and directed Delhi High Court to look into the issue. With IHH acquiring 31% stake in Fortis in 2018, a mandatory open offer for IHH to acquire another 26% stake in Fortis was triggered. Fortis' stock fell 20% to an intraday low of ₹250.35/share on Thursday.

21.title: You could not finish me and won't be able to do it later: Fadnavis to Uddhav
21.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis took a jibe at former CM Uddhav Thackeray and said that he won't be able to finish him ever. "You tried your best, along with Congress and the NCP. You could not finish me and won't be able to do it later," he said. "Whatever is written in the destiny will only happen," Fadnavis added.

22.title: Wife hits husband, his lover after catching them in Agra hotel; video surfaces
22.article_body: A woman hit her husband and his lover with a slipper after catching them in a hotel room in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. A video of the incident showed the man apologising to his wife while the woman's brother reportedly live-streamed the incident on social media. She can also be heard requesting that police be called to the room.

23.title: Received huge amount of hate mail after calling moonlighting 'cheating': Premji
23.article_body: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji said he has received a huge amount of hate mail since calling moonlighting 'cheating', adding that he stands by what he said. "There's a lot of chatter about people moonlighting in the tech industry. This is cheating - plain and simple," Premji had tweeted in August. Wipro has fired 300 people for working for its competitors.

24.title: RSS head meets All India Imam Organization chief at Delhi mosque
24.article_body: RSS head Mohan Bhagwat on Thursday met Imam Umer Ahmed Ilyasi, the chief of All India Imam Organization in a mosque at Kasturba Gandhi Marg in Delhi. The closed-door meeting reportedly lasted over an hour. "RSS Sarsanghachalak meets people from all walks of life. It is part of the continuous general 'Samvad' process," RSS Prachar Pramukh Sunil Ambekar said.

25.title: 8 people injured after cab overturns in J&K's Rajouri
25.article_body: Eight people suffered injuries as the cab they were travelling in overturned after skidding off in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Thursday morning. The accident took place near Magi Mohre when the cab was coming from Bufliaz. Following the incident, passersby took the injured persons to a nearby hospital where their condition was said to be stable, ANI reported.

26.title: 6 drug peddlers held in Hyderabad; hash oil, 2 kg marijuana seized
26.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Wednesday arrested six interstate drug peddlers and seized 202 bottles of hash oil worth ₹4 lakh and two kg of marijuana worth ₹80,000 from them. The police also seized two bikes from the accused. The accused bought the contraband from Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam, police said in a press release, adding that two other accused are currently absconding.

27.title: Dheeraj Dhoopar quits 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' due to health issues: Report
27.article_body: Television actor Dheeraj Dhoopar has reportedly quit 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' owing to his health issues. The actor had injured himself last week. "With the injury yet to heal, it did not seem feasible for him to continue. He discussed the same with the makers who amicably agreed to let him go," a source told The Indian Express.

28.title: 3 die, 6 injured as bus overturns trying to save bike in Chhattisgarh
28.article_body: At least three persons were killed and six others were injured on Wednesday after a bus overturned in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur. The bus was going from Pathalgaon to Ambikapur and it overturned while trying to save a bike coming from the wrong side, an official said. Among the deceased, two were riding on the bike and one was a bus passenger.

29.title: Rupee ends at new all-time low of 80.86 against US dollar
29.article_body: The rupee ended at a record low of 80.86 against the US dollar on Thursday, down from 79.97 in the previous session. This was the biggest single-day fall for the rupee since February 24. The dollar surged to a fresh two-decade high on Wednesday after the US Federal Reserve raised interest rates by another 75 basis points.

30.title: Taapsee Pannu gets mobbed by media photographers, video goes viral
30.article_body: A video shows actress Taapsee Pannu getting mobbed by media photographers after a movie screening. A person near Taapsee asked her about comedian Raju Srivastava's death while several people blocked her path. "Give me a minute. Please step aside, don't do this, move a little bit, step back," she said and then quickly walked away after saying 'thank you'.

31.title: Want to be known for craft, not just box office numbers: Ali Abbas Zafar
31.article_body: Director Ali Abbas Zafar has said he doesn't want to be known just by the box office numbers of his films but also for his craft as a filmmaker. He said he admires filmmakers who have been diverse in their filmmaking choices. He added he's "highly inspired by the filmography" of late Yash Chopra, who "made all kinds of films".

32.title: We're planning to make 'Karthikeya 3', this time in 3D: Nikhil Siddhartha
32.article_body: Telugu actor Nikhil Siddhartha has confirmed the third instalment of the 'Karthikeya' franchise. "With everyone's blessings, we are planning to make 'Karthikeya 3'," he said, adding that this time it's "more exciting" as the makers are planning to make the film in 3D. Currently, Nikhil is busy promoting the Malayalam version of 'Karthikeya 2', which will release on September 23.

33.title: Teacher canes 13-yr-old student, uses casteist slurs in Pune; booked
33.article_body: The Rural Police have booked a school teacher from a village in Maharashtra's Pune district for allegedly caning a 13-year-old student and hurling casteist slurs against him. According to the complaint filed by the family members, the teacher caned the student on his back during ongoing school classes, said Inspector Narayan Pawar, in-charge of Yavat police station.

34.title: Kerala man sets 75-yr-old mother on fire for not giving money to buy liquor
34.article_body: A 55-year-old man in Kerala's Thrissur was arrested for reportedly setting his 75-year-old mother on fire after she refused to give him money to buy liquor. The woman has suffered severe burn injuries. According to the information received by the police, the man would frequently attack his mother when she refused to give him money for liquor.

35.title: Chunky was called revolving door, one girl entered as another left: Bhavana
35.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Bhavana Pandey, during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', revealed her husband Chunky Panday was called a "revolving door". "[Revolving door] means, one girl used to leave from one door...another one would enter from the other. He was called that and that's what I heard when I got married to him," she added.

36.title: Assam man who raped 11-yr-old niece, gave her ₹100 & chips gets life sentence
36.article_body: A court in Assam has sentenced a 31-year-old man to life imprisonment for raping his 11-year-old niece. The convict had lured the minor to his house, raped her and given her ₹100 and a chips packet. The girl came home crying and told her mother about the incident. He had threatened to kill her family if they file a complaint.

37.title: We're fighting a machine that has captured India's institutional framework: Rahul
37.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said, "We're fighting a machine that has captured the institutional framework of India." He added, "They've unlimited money to pressurise and threaten people. The outcome of that is what we've witnessed in Goa." Speaking about the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', he said it is designed to tell the people that they need to be united.

38.title: BJP spent ₹340 cr on poll campaign in 5 states, max in UP: Report
38.article_body: BJP spent over ₹340 crore in the Assembly elections held in five states, including UP, Punjab, Goa, Manipur and Uttarakhand, earlier this year, according to an election expenditure report submitted to Election Commission. The report showed that BJP spent the maximum amount of ₹221.32 crore in Uttar Pradesh. Meanwhile, Congress spent over ₹194 crore for campaigning in these five states.

39.title: Drunk men assault 4 friends outside ahata in Gurugram
39.article_body: Six men reportedly assaulted four friends outside an ahata (drinking place) in Gurugram on Sunday. The youths were partying when a drunk man came to their table and started abusing them. They calmed him down and went towards parking to avoid tension, but he called his friends, who intercepted them and started hitting them with liquor bottles, the complainant said.

40.title: 22-year-old man in Mumbai for army interview run over by train; dies
40.article_body: A 22-year-old man, who had come to Thane for an interview under the 'Agnipath' scheme, reportedly died after being run over by a speeding train at Mumbra railway station. The deceased has been identified as Rameshwar Deore. He was rushed to Thane Civil Hospital, but doctors declared him brought dead, police said.

41.title: 2 LeT terrorists, planning to attack civilians, arrested in J&K's Sopore
41.article_body: Two Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorists were arrested following a joint cordon and search operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Sopore area on Wednesday. The apprehended persons, identified as Imtiaz Ahmad Ganai and Waseem Ahmad Lone, were allegedly planning to attack security forces & civilians. Police also seized one pistol, eight pistol rounds and one Chinese hand grenade from them.

42.title: China calls for dialogue after Russian President's warning to West
42.article_body: Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said Beijing urged all parties engaged in Russia-Ukraine conflict to hold dialogue and consultation and find a way to address the security concerns. The statement comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin issued a warning to the West on using nuclear weapons. Putin announced mobilisation of hundreds of thousands of soldiers to fight in Ukraine.

43.title: G7 vows targeted sanctions against Russia in further support for Ukraine
43.article_body: Foreign Ministers of the Group of Seven (G7) nations, who met on the sidelines of the 77th session of the UN General Assembly, pledged to pursue targeted sanctions against Russia in further cooperation to support Ukraine. The leaders "deplored deliberate Russian escalatory steps". They also criticised Russia's plan to hold referenda on Ukrainian territory, calling it a sham.

44.title: Video shows police lathi-charging fans during ticket sale for India-Aus match in Hyderabad
44.article_body: Police resorted to lathi-charge to disperse the fans after chaos broke out during the ticket sale for India-Australia T20I match in Hyderabad. Several people were injured, including police officials, and they have been moved to hospital for treatment. The match is scheduled to take place at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium on September 25.

45.title: I've never seen anything like this: Angelina Jolie in flood-hit Pakistan
45.article_body: Actress Angelina Jolie, who is in Pakistan to provide help to people affected by floods, has said, "I've never seen anything like this...I am overwhelmed." She added, ''I think this is a real wake-up call to the world about where we are at and that climate change is not only real and it's not only coming, it's very much here."

46.title: Significant breach: Singapore Telecom's Australian unit on customer data leak
46.article_body: Optus, the Australian unit of Singapore Telecommunications, called the unauthorised access of its customer details "a significant breach by Australian standards". "While we're not aware of customers having suffered any harm, we encourage customers to have heightened awareness," Optus said. Optus CEO KB Rosmarin said in "a rare number of cases, passport and the mailing address" had been exposed.

47.title: Assam man rapes 11-year-old niece, gives her ₹100; gets life imprisonment
47.article_body: An Assam court awarded a 31-year-old man life imprisonment for raping his 11-year-old niece under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012. The man enticed the minor to his house, raped her and sent her with a ₹100 note and a packet of chips, the victim's mother said. The accused allegedly threatened to kill her family members.

48.title: Russia-Finland border traffic rises after Putin's mobilisation move
48.article_body: The Finnish Border Guard on Thursday said that traffic arriving at Finland's eastern border with Russia "intensified" overnight. It comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday ordered a partial mobilisation for the war in Ukraine. A total of 4,824 Russians arrived in Finland on Wednesday, up from the 3,133 a week earlier, the Finnish Border Guard added.

49.title: Astronaut shares pics of how a rocket launch looks from space
49.article_body: Astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti, who's currently aboard the International Space Station (ISS), spotted the Russian Soyuz rocket's launch from space. Cristoforetti shared the pictures of how the rocket launch looked from space on social media and said it was a "spectacular view". A Russian Soyuz rocket carrying a NASA astronaut and two Russian cosmonauts launched from Kazakhstan on Wednesday.

50.title: What I'm today, can be accredited to 'Kasautii...' & Ektaa: Ronit Roy
50.article_body: Actor Ronit Roy has said that he started off his acting career with ₹1,500 a day and added that it took a while to earn a cheque of ₹1 lakh monthly. "It was not just the cheque, it's my entire life. What I am today, can be accredited to 'Kasautii Zindagii Kay', Ektaa Kapoor and Balaji Telefilms," he further added.

51.title: TN man kills grandmother for insisting his mother returns borrowed money
51.article_body: A man allegedly killed his 70-year-old grandmother after an argument and let her bleed to death while he continued to watch TV. The victim had been insisting her daughter, who is the accused's mother, to return the ₹1 lakh she had borrowed. In a fit of rage, the accused first slashed the victim and then attacked her with a hammer.

52.title: Man swallows 116 pellets of cocaine worth ₹15 cr, held in Mumbai
52.article_body: A 51-year-old Congo national was arrested after he swallowed 116 pellets stuffed with cocaine weighing 1.5 kilograms, worth approximately ₹15 crore, in a smuggling bid in Mumbai. After his arrest, the man passed 115 pellets through his stool, while the last pellet got stuck in his stomach's end. Doctors performed an endoscopy-guided laparoscopy surgery to pull out the last pellet.

53.title: YouTuber purposely crashes car to test iPhone 14 Pro's crash detection feature
53.article_body: 'TechRax' YouTube channel's owner Taras Maksimuk purposely crashed a car with an iPhone 14 Pro taped to a seat to test the phone's crash detection feature. After crashing the remote-controlled car into a pile of old vehicles, he said, "I can confirm the crash detection works." The crash detection feature connects the user with emergency services and notifies emergency contacts.

54.title: ₹859 cr tender finalised for 2nd corridor of B'luru suburban rail project
54.article_body: The Karnataka government has finalised a tender valued at ₹859 crore for construction of a 25-km second stretch of the proposed four-corridor suburban railway system in Bengaluru, state minister V Somanna said. Basic infrastructure for the second stretch will be completed in 27 months, he added. Karnataka government has spent ₹120 crore for suburban railway's preparatory work, he further said.

55.title: Near-total internet blackout in Iran amid protests against Mahsa Amini's death
55.article_body: Iranians witnessed a near-total internet blackout on Wednesday amid protests against the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was detained for allegedly violating Islamic dress code. According to internet watchdog NetBlocks, Iran curbed access to social media platforms like Instagram and WhatsApp. Security forces used tear gas and water cannons to disperse protesters, Amnesty International said.

56.title: Kamal Haasan starts shooting for 'Indian 2', shares pics
56.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan on Thursday shared that he has started shooting for 'Indian 2'. On Twitter, he shared a couple of pictures of himself with director Shankar. The news comes a day after Kajal Aggarwal announced that she has started preparing for 'Indian 2' four months after giving birth to her son Neil. It will also star Rakul Preet Singh.

57.title: Never looked at making 'Ponniyin Selvan' as web series: Mani Ratnam
57.article_body: Director Mani Ratnam said when he first read Kalki Krishnamurthy's five-part novel 'Ponniyin Selvan', he imagined it fit for the big screen adaptation. "It has always been a film for me," he said, adding that he never looked at the option of making his upcoming film 'Ponniyin Selvan' as a web series. The film will release on September 30.

58.title: Water cannons used on BJP workers heading towards Punjab CM's residence
58.article_body: Police used water cannons against BJP workers who were marching towards Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's residence in Chandigarh on Thursday. The workers, planning to gherao the residence, were holding a counter-protest against the state government. They were seen trying to scale barricades. Earlier, AAP MLAs protested against Punjab Governor Banwarilal Purohit's decision over a special Assembly session.

59.title: Heard that Nitish Kumar, Tejashwi are sad about Shah's Bihar visit: RS Prasad
59.article_body: Ahead of Union Home Minister Amit Shah's visit to Bihar, BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "I've heard that Lalu Ji (RJD chief), Nitish Ji (Bihar CM) and Deputy CM Tejashwi Ji are sad that...Amit Shah is coming to Bihar." Furthermore, he asked, "Does the Home Minister now need to take a directive from them to go to Bihar?"

60.title: At least 1 dead as Mexico hit by 2nd powerful earthquake in a week
60.article_body: At least one person has been killed after a 6.8-magnitude earthquake struck western Mexico on Thursday. The woman died after she fell down the stairs of her home in Mexico City as quake alarms rang out and buildings began to shake, officials said. This comes three days after a 7.6-magnitude earthquake shook western and central Mexico, killing two people.

61.title: Fight breaks out between students in Ghaziabad, continues even after 2 get hit by car
61.article_body: A fight broke out on Wednesday afternoon between students of a Ghaziabad college, and continued despite two of them being struck by a speeding car. The police said several students have been detained after the incident. "The car was being driven by a student who lost control and could not apply brakes on time," said an official.

62.title: 106 PFI members arrested in raids by NIA, ED across 11 states
62.article_body: As many as 106 PFI members were arrested in raids jointly carried out by the NIA, the ED and police across 11 states. Over 1,500 law enforcement personnel were reportedly involved in the operation. Offices and residences of those allegedly involved in "funding terrorism, organising training camps and radicalising people to join proscribed organisations" were raided, reported ANI.

63.title: People look for drama anywhere: Olivia on Harry-Chris' spitting reports
63.article_body: Olivia Wilde has clarified that Harry Styles didn't spit on Chris Pine during the Venice premiere of 'Don't Worry Darling'. Wilde called it a "perfect example" of how people "look for drama anywhere they can". Her reaction has come days after a video went viral, in which fans claimed that Styles had spit on Chris Pine.

64.title: Pune is the flag bearer of Indian culture: Nirmala Sitharaman
64.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Wednesday inaugurated 'Bharat Vidya', an online platform of courses started by the Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute (BORI) in Pune. She said, "The contribution by...(BORI) for Pune and...rest of the country is significant." "Pune is the flag bearer of Indian culture and...by digitising the data of rare books and manuscripts is the next step," she added.

65.title: E-bike rental service approved in Pune, 5,000 vehicles to run on pilot basis
65.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has approved the implementation of electric bike rental service in the city on a pilot basis for one year. Around 5,000 e-bikes will be available during the pilot phase and citizens will be able to rent them at a rate of ₹4 per kilometre. The bikes would be available at 250 locations across the city.

66.title: Jaishankar compares India & China's economy, lists '3 big things that went wrong for us'
66.article_body: Comparing the economies of India and China in US, MEA S Jaishankar said, "There were three big things which went wrong for us; one was of course at the start, the Partition, the delay in exercising the nuclear option, and delay in economic reform." He added, "China grew in this period territorially. China exercised its nuclear option early in 1964."

67.title: 'The Kashmir Files' & 'Rocketry' should also be sent to Oscars: Madhavan
67.article_body: Actor-director R Madhavan said India should also consider sending 'Rocketry' and 'The Kashmir Files' to the Oscars. His reaction has come after Gujarati film 'Chhello Show' was announced as India's official entry to the upcoming 95th Academy Awards. "I'm starting a campaign for Rocketry," he said. On 'Chhello Show', Madhavan said he hopes the film wins and makes India proud.

68.title: You came using PM Modi's photo, backstabbed BJP: Fadnavis to Uddhav
68.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Thursday criticised former CM Uddhav Thackeray saying, "In 2019 polls, you [Thackeray] came [to power] by showing PM [Narendra] Modi's photo, backstabbed BJP and went with Congress and NCP." "[You] tried your best to finish me [but] could not…and won't be able to do it later," he added.

69.title: TCS mandates employees to work from office 3 times a week
69.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services has sent an email to its employees mandating them to work from the office three times a week. The email further stated that managers will create a roster, and adhering to the roster is mandatory. It also said, "Needless to mention, any non-compliance will be taken seriously, and administrative measures may be applied."

70.title: 26-yr-old woman dies by suicide over harassment by youth in UP
70.article_body: A 26-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide after being harassed by a youth and his two friends in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Wednesday. According to the woman's family, the accused used to harass her for marriage and it continued even after she got married. The accused had reportedly threatened to kill the woman's husband and mother-in-law for rejecting his proposal.

71.title: Stampede at Hyd's Gymkhana for Ind-Aus cricket match tickets; 4 injured
71.article_body: A stampede broke out at Hyderabad's Gymkhana Ground after a huge crowd gathered to get tickets for the upcoming India versus Australia match scheduled for 25th September at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. Four people were injured in the incident. People reportedly queued outside the ticket counter since 5 am to buy tickets. Police lathi-charged to control the situation.

72.title: Hungarian PM says EU's sanctions on Russia should be scrapped: Report
72.article_body: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán told his ruling party that European Union's sanctions against Russia should be scrapped, a report said. According to a news platform, Orbán said EU sanctions have driven up gas prices and inflation, and if these measures were to be scrapped, gas prices would drop by 50%. "Sanctions are hurting Europe more than Russia," Orbán reiterated.

73.title: Rahul Gandhi resumes 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', plants sapling at Aluva college
73.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday resumed 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Kerala's Aluva by planting a sapling brought from Lakshadweep at the premises of the Union Christian College, Aluva. "Rahul Gandhi paid tribute at a mango tree planted by Bapu there in the year 1925," Congress tweeted. On the 15th day of the 'yatra', many people joined Gandhi.

74.title: Congress President election schedule released, result on Oct 19
74.article_body: Congress released the schedule for election of its party President on Thursday. The nominations can be filed between September 24 and 30, while the list of final candidates will be published on October 8. The date of polling, if needed, will be October 17. Counting of votes and declaration of the result will be done on October 19.

75.title: Around 500 trees uprooted in Pune in last 3 months claiming lives
75.article_body: Pune witnessed around 500 tree-fall incidents in past three months which led to many deaths and serious injuries, Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) environment department said. Unplanned pruning of trees and putting concrete around trunks are key reasons for increase in tree-fall incidents, an official said. While inspecting, the officials found that many old trees don't have strong bases.

76.title: Supreme Court reserves judgement in Karnataka hijab ban case
76.article_body: Supreme Court reserved its judgement after hearing petitions challenging Karnataka High Court's order upholding hijab ban in educational institutes. "For those who are believers, it's essential. For those who are not...it's not essential," the advocate representing Muslim appellants said. Hijab is only restricted in classrooms, Karnataka Advocate General Prabhuling Navadgi told SC on Wednesday.

77.title: Fee hike by 400 times 'falsehood': Allahabad University amid protests
77.article_body: Allahabad University Vice-Chancellor Sangita Srivastava said that the claim of a hike in fees by 400 times was a "falsehood". This comes amid ongoing protests by students against fee hike. "The fee per student annually for the past several decades was ₹975 which comes to ₹81 per month...fee has been enhanced to ₹4,151 per year- ₹333 per month," Srivastava added.

78.title: Ford India finalises severance package for Chennai plant workers
78.article_body: Ford India, a subsidiary of US-based carmaker Ford, arrived at a final severance package for the workers of its Chennai plant after it decided to shut the plant down as part of a restructuring exercise. A cumulative severance package for each employee would range from ₹34.50 lakh-₹86.50 lakh and revised settlement would be an average of about 5.1 years' salary.

79.title: Ukraine calls for Russia to be stripped of veto rights at UNSC
79.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged the UN to impose "just punishment" on Russia and strip it of its UN Security Council (UNSC) veto power. Russia is a permanent UNSC member along with US, France, Britain and China. The UNSC meeting comes a day after Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered mobilisation of hundreds of thousands of troops to fight in Ukraine.

80.title: Ashneer shares pic with Kohli, says 'Delhi boys with common passion for 'Ben Stokes''
80.article_body: BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover on Wednesday shared a picture with Virat Kohli and wrote, "What could the Delhi boys with a common passion for 'Ben Stokes' be discussing?" "All the best Virat Kohli for the match in Nagpur," he tweeted. The second T20I between India and Australia will be played in Nagpur tomorrow.

81.title: UP Assembly reserves today for women MLAs to raise their issues
81.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Assembly has reserved Thursday, September 22, for women MLAs to raise their issues, a step that Speaker Satish Mahana said no other legislative Assembly in the country has taken so far. There are 47 women MLAs in the 403-member UP Legislative Assembly and out of which 22 are first-timers.

82.title: Efforts on to change country's history: West Bengal CM Mamata
82.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday inaugurated the Alipore Independence Museum and said that the state has played an important role in country's struggle for independence. However, without naming anyone, Banerjee alleged that the country's history is being "changed" so that the future generation remains unaware. She added that it's the TMC government which is trying to "save" history.

83.title: SpiceJet pilots to get 20% pay hike, days after 80 of them sent on unpaid leave
83.article_body: SpiceJet will give a 20% salary hike to its pilots in October this year. This comes days after the airline sent 80 pilots on 3-month unpaid leave as a temporary measure to rationalise costs. As a part of the Emergency Credit Line Guarantee Scheme, SpiceJet has reportedly received the first tranche of payment and the second tranche is expected soon.

84.title: Class 1 girl gets locked up in school for 18 hours in UP's Sambhal
84.article_body: A seven-year-old girl was left locked behind in a school for about 18 hours in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal district. The girl's relatives went looking for her but the school staff told her grandmother that no children were left there. The girl, a Class 1 student, was found only after the school reopened the next morning on Wednesday.

85.title: PFI workers protest in Kerala, K'taka, Tamil Nadu after NIA raids
85.article_body: The workers of Popular Front of India (PFI) took to the streets in Kerala, Karnataka and Tamil Nadu after the NIA raided its offices and leaders' residences across the country on Thursday. The agency raided multiple locations in about 10 states and arrested over 100 PFI members. The workers raised slogans against the central government and its investigating agencies.

86.title: Land worth ₹70 cr cleared in Greater Noida in anti-encroachment drive
86.article_body: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) on Wednesday cleared about 35,000 square meters of land worth ₹70 crore in an anti-encroachment drive in Sunpura. "Five JCBs were operated for about one-and-a-half hours," an official said. "An elimination squad has been formed to stop illegal occupation...GNIDA has deployed retired Army personnel...at its own expense," GNIDA CEO said.

87.title: Delhi government cuts school exam budget to ₹90 per student
87.article_body: The Delhi government has cut down the budget for conducting exams at government schools from ₹125 to ₹90 per student from Class 1 to Class 11 for 2022-23, the Directorate of Education (DoE) said in a circular. The DoE cited "shortage of budget" as reason behind the price deduction. "Demand of additional budget will not be entertained," the circular added.

88.title: Over 1,300 arrested at anti-mobilisation protests in Russia
88.article_body: Protests were held in several cities in Russia on Wednesday against President Vladimir Putin's announcement of a partial mobilisation of reservists to fight in Ukraine. Over 1,300 people were arrested at anti-mobilisation rallies in 38 cities, including Moscow, Russian protest monitoring group OVD-Info said. Meanwhile, most flights out of Russia were sold out after Putin's announcement.

89.title: Russians google 'How to leave Russia', 'How to break arm at home' amid mobilisation call
89.article_body: Google search trends in Russia showed a spike in queries like "how to leave Russia" and "how to break an arm at home" ahead of President Vladimir Putin's address on Wednesday in which he was likely to announce "martial law" and "mobilisation". Putin ordered country's first mobilisation since World War II, warning that he is not bluffing about nuclear attack.

90.title: Pune civic body to use automated vehicles to catch stray animals
90.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to use automated vehicles with hydraulic systems to catch stray animals in the city. According to a civic official, a tender for such vehicles will be issued soon. "A minimum of one vehicle will be given to each ward and its number may increase as per the requirement," said PMC official Jalinder Kharmade.

91.title: N Korea may soon launch new missile submarine: US-based think tank
91.article_body: North Korea might be preparing to launch a new submarine believed to be capable of firing ballistic missiles, a US-based think tank 38 North said, citing commercial satellite imagery. The images by the Sinpho South Shipyard from September 18 show never-seen-before vessels gathered around the construction hall quay. In May this year, North Korea test-fired a submarine-launched ballistic missile.

92.title: US President Joe Biden appears lost on stage after his speech; video surfaces
92.article_body: A video of US President Joe Biden appearing lost on stage after his speech at an event has surfaced on social media. The US President was addressing the Global Fund's Seventh Replenishment Conference in New York on Wednesday. After his address, he turned to leave the podium but stopped and looked lost.

93.title: SBI stock falls marginally after it raises ₹4,000 crore via bonds
93.article_body: A day after the State Bank of India raised ₹4,000 crore Basel III compliant Tier 2 bonds, its shares traded lower on Thursday. At 11:50 am, it was trading at ₹566.05 apiece, down 0.64% on NSE. SBI's issue was oversubscribed by about five times against the base issue size of ₹2,000 crore with bids of ₹9,647 crore.

94.title: Comedian Raju Srivastava cremated in Delhi
94.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava was cremated at Nigambodh Ghat crematorium in Delhi on Thursday. He passed away on Wednesday at the age of 58. Srivastava was admitted to the All India Institute Of Medical Sciences in Delhi last month after suffering a heart attack and collapsing while working out at a gym.

95.title: Why do you need 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', India is strongly united: Amarinder Singh
95.article_body: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh questioned the need for Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "In the first instance, why do you need a 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'? India is strongly united already and is going from strength to strength," Singh added. "Yes, you may need to unite Congress and you should've named it appropriately. Maybe, it would've helped," he stated.

96.title: My father ran out of money in 90s, me & my brother supported him: Musk
96.article_body: The world’s richest person Elon Musk on Twitter revealed that his father, Errol, ran out of money in the 90s and that it was he and his brother who financially supported him. Musk was responding to a thread wherein a US professor claimed that Musk's family owned emerald mines in Apartheid-era South Africa, to which Musk called him a "liar".

97.title: HRERA restricts sale, purchase of properties in Gurugram's Vatika project
97.article_body: The Haryana Real Estate Regulatory Authority (HRERA) has restricted sale and purchase of properties in Vatika Limited's residential projects in Gurugram's sector 88A and 88B, the authority said in a statement. Stating the reason behind the restriction, HRERA said that licence of the project expired in 2019 and the developer is yet to submit documents required for completing mandatory registration.

98.title: SpiceJet shares fall most in 3 weeks after DGCA extends ops cap
98.article_body: A day after the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) extended restrictions on SpiceJet to operate at 50% capacity till October 29, its stock was trading 4% down on NSE on Thursday, the most in three weeks. At 11:27 am, it was trading at ₹40.15, down 4.06%. DGCA noted that the restrictions were extended "as a matter of abundant caution".

99.title: Tamil Nadu DMK MLA threatens auto firm's CEO, booked; video surfaces
99.article_body: Tamil Nadu DMK MLA SR Raja has been booked for threatening the CEO of an auto firm in Chengalpattu, police said. The incident was caught on camera wherein the MLA can be seen threatening and verbally abusing the firm's employees in Maraimalai Nagar. Raja was booked on Wednesday for using obscene language, trespassing and criminal intimidation, police added.

100.title: Ex-Honduras First Lady gets 14 years in prison on fraud charges
100.article_body: A court in Honduras has sentenced the country's former First Lady Rosa Bonilla to 14 years and one month in prison on charges of fraud and misappropriation of public funds destined for social programs. Bonilla spent around $590,000 meant for low-income children on personal credit card payments, her children's school fees and real estate construction, according to the public ministry.

101.title: Locals get authorities to construct road overnight at gunpoint in Gurugram, 30 booked
101.article_body: Police have booked 30 locals in Gurugram for allegedly threatening officials of Metropolitan Development Authority at gunpoint and forcing workers to construct a patch of road overnight. Police said Hoshiar Singh initiated the quarrel because he wanted a road constructed in front of his petrol pump. Singh said all villagers wanted the road because over 20 mishaps occurred there recently.

102.title: Reliance Retail is in talks to acquire Sephora India rights: Report
102.article_body: Reliance Retail is reportedly in advanced talks to get the rights for beauty retailer Sephora in India. According to a report, if the agreement is reached, Sephora's operations will transfer from Arvind Fashions to Reliance Retail. Sephora, owned by French luxury goods group LVMH, has 25 stores in India with brands in categories such as cosmetics and fragrances, among others.

103.title: Govt has taken revolutionary step in education field by bringing NEP: Thakur
103.article_body: The central government has taken a revolutionary step in the fields of sports, education, skill development and regional language education by bringing New Education Policy, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said. Furthermore, he said, today's era is about women empowerment, the biggest proof of which is that women are advancing in every field, especially education and sports.

104.title: Swiggy delivery agents in Chennai protest against revised payment rules
104.article_body: After Swiggy changed its pay structure this week, delivery agents have been protesting in various locations in Chennai, leading to a disruption in services. The agents alleged that according to the new rules, they would have to finish 180 orders a week to earn ₹11,500. Swiggy said that the new structure is created to provide more flexibility to delivery workers.

105.title: IMD predicts moderate to heavy rainfall in Delhi today, yellow alert issued
105.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted moderate rainfall and thundershowers, with heavy rainfall in one or two places in Delhi for Thursday. The weather agency has also issued a 'yellow' alert in the city for the day. While the maximum temperature is likely to be around 31°C, the minimum temperature registered earlier in the day was 23.8°C.

106.title: PM Modi has a powerful, influential voice on the world stage: UK
106.article_body: After Prime Minister Narendra Modi told Russian President Vladimir Putin that this is not the time for war, UK Foreign Secretary James Cleverly said, "PM Modi has a powerful, influential voice on the world stage." "We know the Russian leadership respects India's voice and position on the world stage. I think PM Modi's intervention is very, very welcome," he added.

107.title: Mumbai Metro sells naming rights of 5 stations for ₹216 crore
107.article_body: The Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation sold naming rights of five stations on the Colaba-Bandra-SEEPZ Metro 3 corridor for ₹216 crore. The five stations are Bandra Kurla Complex, Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, Siddhivinayak Metro Station, Churchgate and Hutatma Chowk. The buyers, including LIC, ICICI Lombard and Kotak Mahindra Bank, will be able to use their names in the stations as prefixes.

108.title: Monthly rent in Bengaluru's JP Nagar rose 13% since 2020: Report
108.article_body: Monthly rentals in Bengaluru's JP Nagar rose by 13 percent to ₹52,000 in 2022 from ₹46,000 in 2020, data from real estate consultant Anarock showed. The data further stated that among seven major cities in India, Bengaluru saw highest capital appreciation of nine percent, which meant average prices per square feet increased to ₹6,200 in 2022 from ₹5,698 in 2020.

109.title: Clarify that Jagan Mohan Reddy is not permanent president: EC to YSRCP
109.article_body: Election Commission (EC) on Wednesday directed YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) to clarify that Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy is not its permanent president. EC added that it "categorically rejects any attempt or even a hint of any organisational post being of permanent nature". This comes amid reports claiming that Reddy has been appointed the party's permanent president.

110.title: 21-yr-old college student shares messages sent by Maroon 5 singer Adam Levine
110.article_body: A 21-year-old college student named Ashley Russell has shared messages that Maroon 5 singer Adam Levine sent her. Russell said that, earlier this year, the Maroon 5 singer would watch her Instagram stories, like her posts and message her directly. "He would like mainly like booty stories," she further said.

111.title: After Johny Lever, Raju Srivastava connected well with audience: Jaaved
111.article_body: Jaaved Jaaferi said Raju Srivastava was the only comedian after Johny Lever who connected well with the audience. "He bridged the gap between English and non-English speaking audience through his comedy shows," Jaaved said. He said Raju's "earthy" humour catered to a wide Indian sensibility. "Wherever he stood among the people, he used to make them laugh," he added.

112.title: 7 injured as car rams into pedestrians in Mumbai, CCTV footage surfaces
112.article_body: Seven people were seriously injured after a car rammed into them, while also hitting auto-rickshaws and a tempo in Mumbai's Ghatkopar on Wednesday. The incident, which was captured on CCTV, took place around 1.37 pm when an auto-rickshaw driver entered his friend's car to charge his mobile and accidentally accelerated it. Police arrested the accused on charges of negligent driving.

113.title: N Korea denies sending arms to Russia, asks US to 'keep mouth shut'
113.article_body: North Korea said it has "never exported weapons or ammunition to Russia" and has no plans to do so. This comes after US said that Russia was buying artillery shells and rockets from communist North Korea to support its war in Ukraine. The US should stop making "reckless remarks" and "keep its mouth shut", a North Korean defence official said.

114.title: Hijab may promote diversity, make students culturally sensitive: Supreme Court
114.article_body: While hearing the Karnataka hijab ban case, the Supreme Court on Wednesday said, "One can also say, this is an opportunity of being exposed to diversity. We have students from all cultures, religions...look at diversity of the country, be culturally sensitive towards them." It added, "It can be an opportunity to inculcate some values. That can also be a perspective."

115.title: Called 'gaddar', but we're true torchbearers of Balasaheb's ideals: Maha CM
115.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde criticised Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray for "betraying" the Hindutva ideology and called himself as the true torchbearer of the ideals of Balasaheb Thackeray. "We're being called 'gaddar' (betrayers), but it is we who took Balasaheb's ideals forward, while they shortchanged the ideals of Hindutva," he added.

116.title: Delivery man cheats e-commerce firm of ₹7.6 lakh in Pune; arrested
116.article_body: A 24-year-old delivery agent of an e-commerce platform was arrested for allegedly cheating the firm of ₹7.63 lakh in Pune. According to a company representative, the accused rescheduled the delivery of a product that he had already delivered to the customer and collected money for. Instead of passing the amount to the company, he kept it for himself.

117.title: Shah Rukh Khan is the easiest person I’ve met: Gauri Khan
117.article_body: Gauri Khan said her husband and superstar Shah Rukh Khan is the "easiest person" she has ever met. "He's just born a person who's comfortable with people around him. Put him in any situation, he just knows how to deal with it, be comfortable and not throw his weight around. That's one thing I just love about him," she said.

118.title: Russia frees 215 Ukrainians, others in exchange for 55 including Putin ally
118.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said 215 Ukrainian and foreign citizens have been released by Russia in a prisoner exchange. Russia received 55 prisoners including Viktor Medvedchuk, an ex-Ukrainian lawmaker and ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin accused of treason, he added. The swap is the biggest exchange between the two sides since the start of Russia's invasion in February.

119.title: Get your home festive ready with Alexa Smart Home Combo: Amazon
119.article_body: In the lead-up to Amazon Great Indian Festival, Amazon has announced that customers can convert their homes into smart homes with Alexa Smart Home combos starting at ₹1799. With the festival beginning from 23rd September, the brand aims to encourage people to get their wishlist ready before the sale.

120.title: India reports 5,443 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 46,342
120.article_body: India has reported 5,443 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's data. The data showed that 5,291 people recovered in the last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country stood at 46,342. This comes a day after 4,510 new COVID-19 cases were reported in India.

121.title: United Opposition will throw BJP out of power in LS polls: Lalu Yadav
121.article_body: RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav on Wednesday announced that he and Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will meet Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi soon in Delhi. "I'll also meet Rahul Gandhi after the completion of his 'padyatra'. The united Opposition will throw...BJP out of power in the next Lok Sabha polls," Lalu said at the RJD state council meeting in Patna.

122.title: upGrad to invest ₹40 mn more in Harappa Education after acquisition
122.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad will invest an additional $40 million in Harappa Education, an online learning platform, to create Harappa Global School of Leadership. upGrad had announced the acquisition of Harappa Education in July 2022 at a valuation of $38 million. In August 2022, upGrad announced securing an additional $210 million from ETS Global and Bodhi Tree among others.

123.title: 11th accused in Amravati murder case arrested from Mumbai court premises
123.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Wednesday arrested the eleventh accused in the murder case of 54-year-old Amravati pharmacist Umesh Kolhe from the premises of a Mumbai court. The accused had come to surrender before the special court hearing the case, his lawyer said. Kolhe was killed on June 21 after he shared a post purportedly supporting Nupur Sharma's Prophet remarks.

124.title: NSE adds Ambuja Cements and Can Fin Homes to today's F&O ban list
124.article_body: The NSE has added Ambuja Cements and Can Fin Homes to its Futures and Options (F&O) ban list for Thursday after the scrips crossed 95% of the market-wide position limit. On Wednesday, shares of Ambuja Cements fell nearly 6% to ₹541, while Can Fin Homes declined more than 2% to ₹552.4. The exchange, however, removed India Cements from the list.

125.title: 4 minors dead, 2 injured as wall collapses in UP's Etawah amid heavy rain
125.article_body: At least four minors were killed and two others were injured after a wall collapsed amid heavy rainfall in Uttar Pradesh's Etawah. "CM Yogi Adityanath has given instructions to provide relief amount of ₹4 lakh to the next of kin of the deceased," the Chief Minister's office tweeted. Reportedly, the deceased belonged to the same family and were siblings.

126.title: Ranveer, Kareena & Ahan Shetty are my fashion icons: Janhvi Kapoor
126.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor called Ranveer Singh, Kareena Kapoor Khan and Ahan Shetty her fashion icons. Speaking at an event, Janhvi said Ahan "dresses really well", while Ranveer has made an identity of his own and never fails to keep up with audiences' expectations. Janhvi said Kareena carries herself with confidence. "I just can't stop looking at her," she added.

127.title: Man dressed as woman thrashed in Noida over child theft suspicion; 4 held
127.article_body: The GB Nagar Police arrested four people for allegedly thrashing a man in Yakubpur village over suspicions of child theft. The victim, Rahul, was roaming in Yakubpur dressed as a woman and someone spread the rumour that he is a child kidnapper following which the villagers thrashed and later paraded him around the village, the police said.

128.title: TV actor Mahesh Thakur cheated of ₹5.43 crore by his lawyer, case filed
128.article_body: The Mumbai police have registered a case after TV actor Mahesh Thakur was cheated of ₹5.43 crore on the pretext of payment for court fees, legal counselling and other formalities in a legal case. As per the police, Thakur had hired the accused to represent him in a property dispute case. When Thakur asked for the receipts, the accused disappeared.

129.title: D2C firm Join Ventures raises $23.5 mn in Series B funding round
129.article_body: A direct-to-consumer firm Join Ventures has secured $23.5 million in Series B funding round led by MO Alternate Investment Advisors Pvt Ltd. According to a company statement, the round saw participation of Convivialité Ventures along with existing investors like DSG Consumer Partners, Venture Catalysts and ZNL Growth. In February, Join Ventures had raised $10 million in Series A funding round.

130.title: Pune municipal body approves ₹5 crore to beautify public toilets
130.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has approved ₹5 crore to beautify public toilets in the city. "Under the beautification process, PMC will carry out works like changing flooring, installing hand wash basins etc," said an official. "At some places, PMC would need to change the urinal and toilet seats as they are damaged," added the official.

131.title: Sensex falls 370 points, Nifty opens at 17,584 after Fed rate hike
131.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in the red on Thursday amid weak global markets following the US Federal Reserve raising interest rates by 75 basis points. The Sensex fell 370.75 points to 59,086.03, and Nifty was down 133.80 points at 17,584.50. Rupee opened at a fresh record low after falling 31 paise at 80.28 per US dollar against Wednesday's close of 79.97.

132.title: Your healthy lifestyle starts with picking the right cooking oil: Oleev
132.article_body: Oleev Active with the goodness of olive oil is specially created to fulfil the demands of the modern lifestyle, said the brand. It has an Energocules formula that will ensure you stay active and energized throughout the day, it revealed, adding that after all, you are what you eat.

133.title: BJP govt tried every possible way to make us scared: Tejashwi Yadav
133.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government has tried every possible way to make them scared. "There were big hurdles before us, still we were not afraid of BJP and formed government in Bihar," Yadav added. "CM Nitish Kumar took decision at the right time and threw the BJP out of power in Bihar," he stated.

134.title: ₹50 lakh worth of items stolen from jewellery shop in Mumbai
134.article_body: Some unidentified persons allegedly stole nearly ₹50 lakh worth of jewellery from a shop in Mumbai's Ghatkopar on Tuesday night. The suspects reportedly entered the shop through a broken window and made off with gold and silver jewellery kept in the showcase. The police said they have strong leads and should be able to make arrests soon.

135.title: If it's hate speech we feed on, where is our nation headed?: SC on hate speech on TV
135.article_body: Expressing its displeasure over hate speeches via debates on TV channels, the Supreme Court on Wednesday called the "visual media" the "chief medium of hate speech". Justice KM Joseph said, "The most important point is where is our nation headed. If it is hate speech that we are actually feeding on, where is our nation headed?"

136.title: Graphic shows rush of flights leaving Russia after Putin's threat
136.article_body: A graphic shared by global flight tracking service Flightradar24 shows flights leaving Russia after the country's President Vladimir Putin's threat to the West. Putin accused the West of "nuclear blackmail" and said, "If...threatened, we'll use all available means to protect our people - this isn't a bluff." The UK later said, Putin's threats must be taken very seriously.

137.title: Rupee hits record low of 80.28 against US dollar after Fed rate hike
137.article_body: The rupee hit a fresh record low on Thursday after it opened at 80.28 against the US dollar. The currency slipped 0.39% in the opening trade against yesterday’s closing of 79.97. After the US Federal Reserve hiked interest rates by 75 basis points on Wednesday, the US dollar surged to a 20-year high at 111.63.

138.title: Shinde has gone again to perform 'mujra' in Delhi: Thackeray on Vedanta project
138.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday said CM Eknath Shinde has gone again to perform "mujra" in Delhi. His statement came following Vedanta-Foxconn's decision to set up a semiconductor facility in Gujarat. "Why do Maharashtra projects go to other states? Why doesn't he speak to PM about this? Doesn't he have the courage to speak on it?" Thackeray asked.

139.title: Meta looking to cut costs by at least 10% within next few months: Report
139.article_body: Meta is reportedly looking to cut its costs by at least 10% within the next few months. As per a report, Meta has started reorganising departments in terms of staff and asking the affected employees to apply for other roles within the company. Earlier, Meta said it had cut plans to hire engineers by at least 30% this year.

140.title: Traffic police officer hit by speeding car in Gurugram, case filed
140.article_body: A case has been filed after a traffic police official was allegedly hit by a speeding car in Gurugram's Sector-12 area on Tuesday. According to reports, Assistant Sub-Inspector Mukhtyar Singh was managing traffic when he signalled a car with tinted glass windows to stop. However, the driver allegedly stepped on the accelerator and fled, leaving Singh injured, reports stated.

141.title: Partha Chatterjee remanded to judicial custody till Oct 5 in WB SSC scam
141.article_body: Former West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee and three others were remanded to judicial custody till October 5 in connection with the School Service Commission (SSC) recruitment scam. This comes after a court sent the suspended TMC leader to CBI custody till September 21. Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee were arrested by the ED on July 23.

142.title: 30-yr-old kills self in Pune after failing to clear competitive exams
142.article_body: A 30-year-old man died by suicide in Pune due to depression over failing to clear competitive exams despite several attempts, said police. The deceased, who came to Pune from Jalna to prepare for the exams a few years ago, was found locked inside the quarters he shared with his friends. A note was found.

143.title: Trains on main line delayed due to technical glitch at Mumbai's Dadar station
143.article_body: Trains running on the main line were delayed due to a technical problem in signal initiation at Mumbai's Dadar station on Thursday morning, the Central Railways informed. Sharing an update on it, an official said that the problem of signal initiation was examined by staff/officials and resolved but trains on the main line are running late due to bunching.

144.title: 16 COVID-19 deaths reported in last 3 weeks in Thane
144.article_body: About 16 people succumbed to COVID-19 in last three weeks in Maharashtra's Thane. According to Thane's health department, all deceased were aged between 58-60 years and had co-morbidities. However, officials added that the number of infections reduced from around 200-300 per day in August to around 100-180 cases in September, with 50-70 cases being reported daily over last three days.

145.title: Telecom dept director, engineer arrested in Pune over bribery charges
145.article_body: CBI arrested the director and an assistant divisional engineer of the Telecommunication Department of the Ministry of Communications, posted in Pune, while they were accepting a bribe. The two officers work in the office of Advisor, Maharashtra Licensed Service Area. Searches were conducted at the residential and office premises of both the accused, officials said.

146.title: Encroachments near Bengaluru's Greenwood Residency demolished by BBMP
146.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) demolished illegal constructions near Greenwood Residency in Sarjapur as the civic body continued its anti-encroachment drive in Mahadevapura zone. BBMP also removed an RCC bridge (reinforced cement concrete) that was built on a drain channel in Kasavanahalli's Valliyamma layout. Several sheds built on drains in Kasavanahalli were also demolished.

147.title: NIA launches 'largest-ever' searches across India against groups backing terror activities
147.article_body: The NIA on Thursday launched a massive nationwide search operation against groups, including PFI, and individuals allegedly supporting terrorists, officials said. In the "largest ever investigation till date", the searches are taking place at the premises of those allegedly involved in terror funding, organising training camps, and radicalising people to join proscribed organisations, they said.

148.title: Mumbai auto, taxi drivers to go on strike from Sept 26 over fare hike
148.article_body: The auto-rickshaw and taxi unions in Mumbai have decided to go on a strike from September 26 over their demand for an increase in fares. They have postponed the strike twice before, following assurances from the state government in the matter. The taxi union has demanded the minimum fare for 1.5 km to be raised from ₹25 to ₹35.

149.title: Gauri Khan speaks on son Aryan's arrest for the 1st time, says 'Nothing can be worse'
149.article_body: During her appearance on Koffee with Karan, Gauri Khan spoke for the first time about son Aryan's arrest last year. "Nothing can be worse than what we've just been through. But where we all stand as a family, I can say that we are in a great space," she said. "We are grateful to everyone who helped us," she added.

150.title: Flying car company backed by Google Co-founder Larry Page to shut down
150.article_body: Kittyhawk, the air-taxi company backed by billionaire Google Co-founder Larry Page, is closing down. In a LinkedIn post, the company said, "We've made the decision to wind down Kittyhawk. We're still working on the details of what’s next." Kittyhawk was founded in 2010 by Sebastian Thrun and had unveiled a demonstration video of a flying car in 2017.

151.title: Truck driver who mowed down 4 in Delhi held from UP, vehicle seized
151.article_body: The truck driver, who mowed down four persons and injured two others in Delhi's Seemapuri, was arrested from Uttar Pradesh's Shamli, police said. The vehicle has also been seized, police added. The driver was driving rashly and negligently, DCP (Shahdara) R Sathiyasundaram said. The accident took place at 1:51 am on Wednesday, following which two persons died on the spot.

152.title: Conspiracy to defame me: K'taka CM as 'PayCM' posters surface in B'luru
152.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said there is a conspiracy to defame him and damage Karnataka's image, as posters cropped up in Bengaluru with the caption 'PayCM' and a QR code with Bommai's photo on it. BJP leaders in the state have been accused of taking 40% of the contract amount as bribe from contractors for all state-sponsored infrastructural works.

153.title: 2 minors kill man for refusing to give ₹200 for gambling in Delhi
153.article_body: Two minors, aged 13 and 15, have been nabbed by the police for allegedly killing a man who refused to give them ₹200 for gambling in Delhi's Patel Nagar, police said on Wednesday. The accused killed him with a knife, iron rods and bricks when he resisted the robbery bid, police said, adding that another accused is still at large.

154.title: Bengaluru's Cubbon Park planning to ban eatables inside park premises
154.article_body: Authorities of Bengaluru's Cubbon Park are planning to ban eatables within the park and have instructed guards to ensure that no food items are taken inside the park's premises. "Our issue is with those who carry disposable parcels inside the park and dump leftovers...We're fine with visitors bringing well-packed lunch boxes from home," the park's Deputy Director HT Balakrishna said.

155.title: Hospital guards assault 2 youths over parking dispute in Noida, video surfaces
155.article_body: Following a parking dispute, guards of Noida's Yatharth Super Speciality Hospital allegedly assaulted two youths with iron rods. The entire incident was caught on a CCTV camera and has now gone viral on social media. According to reports, the guards asked the victims to not park their car outside the hospital, which sparked a fight.

156.title: 2 workers killed, 4 injured as railway wall collapses on them in Thane
156.article_body: At least two workers were killed and four others were injured after a wall in Thane's Dombivli railway station collapsed on Wednesday evening. While the workers were building a new protection wall to prevent encroachments on station premises, the old wall collapsed on them. The six workers were pulled out from under the debris by other workers and local residents.

157.title: Pedestrian dies after NMMC garbage vehicle hits him in Mumbai
157.article_body: A 61-year-old pedestrian died after a garbage vehicle of Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) reportedly hit him on Sunday near Turbhe Naka. The driver of the vehicle allegedly lost control, hitting the deceased as well as a parked car. The police have registered a case against the 45-year-old driver and detained him. The car was also damaged in the incident.

158.title: 5 celebrate birthday on road in Ghaziabad, beat commuters; arrested
158.article_body: Police have arrested five men for celebrating a birthday party on the road in Ghaziabad. According to a police official, the accused stopped commuters and distributed cake. Furthermore, the accused also abused and beat passengers after stopping them. Sub-inspector Sandeep Kumar said that their ruckus created a long jam on the elevated road.

159.title: Arms dealer arrested with 15 pistols & 45 live cartridges in Delhi
159.article_body: Police have arrested a 32-year-old alleged arms supplier with 15 high-quality semi-automatic pistols and 45 live cartridges in Delhi. The arms were meant to be supplied to gangsters in Delhi and Uttar Pradesh, police said. During interrogation, the accused revealed he used to procure firearms from local manufacturers in Uttar Pradesh's Kairana and would sell them in Baghpat and Shamli.

160.title: US Federal Reserve hikes interest rates by 0.75% for the 3rd time in a row
160.article_body: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its benchmark interest rate by 0.75% for the third straight time. The move will raise its key rate to a range of 3.00% to 3.25%, the highest since 2008. US stock indexes rose on Wednesday ahead of the rate hike announcement by the US Federal Reserve System.

161.title: TRS leaders beat toll plaza staff after row over fee in Telangana
161.article_body: TRS leaders thrashed a toll plaza employee on Wednesday in Telangana after a party leader, who's the Sarpanch from Nasurullabad, was asked to pay toll fee. A CCTV footage showed few people getting out of a car and thrashing the employee before more people entered the scene. The plaza was also vandalised. Police have registered a case against both parties.

162.title: YouTuber & motorist TTF Vasan booked for rash driving in Coimbatore
162.article_body: Days after uploading a video of his ride on social media, YouTuber and motorist TTF Vasan was booked for rash and dangerous driving in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore, police said. Vasan had gone on a ride with influencer GP Muthu on Palakkad Main Road and drove his motorcycle at a very high speed causing a threat to people, officials said.

163.title: EAM Jaishankar informs Ukrainian PM of India's position in war
163.article_body: EAM S Jaishankar met Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal on Wednesday at the UN headquarters and told him that India hopes for "cessation of all hostilities" in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. "Discussed their (the war's) consequences, including for food security, energy security and safety of nuclear facilities," Jaishankar tweeted. The leaders met on the sidelines of a UN General Assembly session.

164.title: Rain killed over 550 children in Pak this year: UNICEF official
164.article_body: Rains and floods have killed over 550 children in Pakistan this year and without a surge in aid more children will die, UNICEF, Pakistan official Gerida Birukila said. She added the floods had displaced 3.4 million children. "The world needs to come together and help the children in Pakistan. Together we can save lives," she said.

165.title: England announce schedule for Ashes 2023
165.article_body: The men's Ashes next year will be contested between June 16 to July 31, with Edgbaston, Lord's, Headingley, Old Trafford and The Oval set to host the Tests, the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) announced. The first Test will begin on June 16 at Edgbaston, while the last Test will take place at The Oval starting July 27.

166.title: Where is brilliance, where is the X-factor: Ravi Shastri on Team India's fielding
166.article_body: Talking about India's fielding in the first T20I against Australia, Ravi Shastri said, "Where is brilliance? Where is that X-factor?" He added, "If you look at all the top Indian teams over the years, there is youth and experience. I find the youth missing here and hence the fielding." Australia defeated India in the first T20I by 4 wickets.

167.title: Mamata ready to bury differences with Cong to form anti-BJP front: Pawar
167.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is ready to bury her differences with Congress and come together to form an alliance of opposition parties against the BJP ahead of 2024 polls. "The rank and file of...TMC was highly disappointed with the Congress after the West Bengal elections, but the party chief amended her stand," Pawar added.

168.title: Nepal President refuses to approve amendments to citizenship law
168.article_body: Nepalese President Bidya Devi Bhandari has refused to approve amendments to the country's citizenship law, which seek to give citizenship certificates to children whose parents' whereabouts are unknown. The deadline for Bhandari to sign the bill was Tuesday midnight. The bill has been passed by the Parliament twice, after Bhandari once earlier had sent it back.

169.title: MSME bad loans for banks may rise to 11% by March 2024: Crisil
169.article_body: Crisil Ratings stated that gross NPAs (GNPA) in the MSME segment may rise to around 10-11% by March 2024. It added that the MSME segment saw a restructuring at around 6%, and about a fourth of these accounts could potentially slip into NPAs. GNPA in the MSME segment was approximately 9.3% as on March 31, 2022.

170.title: Chargesheet filed against Teesta Setalvad, 2 others for false evidence
170.article_body: A Special Investigation Team (SIT) filed a chargesheet against activist Teesta Setalvad, retired Director General of Police R B Sreekumar and dismissed IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt for allegedly 'fabricating evidence' in the 2002 Gujarat riots case. The chargesheet is 6,300 pages and cites 90 witnesses. Teesta Setalvad, arrested on June 26, was released on interim bail on September 2.

171.title: Amanatullah's aide arrested in T'gana after pistol found at premises
171.article_body: The Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested Aam Aadmi Party MLA Amanatullah Khan's close aide Kaushar Imam Siddique under the Arms Act in Telangana. The 47-year-old was wanted after a country-made pistol and three live rounds were found at his premises. Khan's another aide, Hamid Ali, has also been arrested. Khan is an accused in the Delhi Waqf Board corruption case.

172.title: India's mineral production falls 3.3% in July 2022
172.article_body: According to provisional data by the government, the country's mineral production declined by 3.3% in July 2022 compared to the same month in the previous year. The cumulative year-on-year growth during the April-July period of the ongoing fiscal stood at 6.1%. The important minerals which showed positive growth in July 2022 were phosphorite, coal, copper concentrate, and zinc concentrate.

173.title: Telangana govt to distribute 1 cr Bathukamma sarees from tomorrow
173.article_body: The Telangana government has announced that the annual distribution of Bathukamma sarees to women in the state will begin tomorrow (Thursday). The government will distribute nearly one crore sarees this year. Telangana Textiles and Handlooms Minister KT Rama Rao said the initiative was first launched in 2017 to support weavers amid unemployment and to present a small gift to women.

174.title: US' 'One China' policy remains unchanged: White House
174.article_body: US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan has said there is no change in the US' 'One China' policy and it is "against unilateral changes to the status quo". Sullivan's remarks come after President Joe Biden earlier said the US would defend Taiwan in the event of an invasion. Under the "One China" policy, Taiwan is a part of China.

175.title: Danish queen COVID +ve after attending Queen Elizabeth's funeral
