Furthermore, he said, "I'll again request Rahul Gandhi. If he conducts 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' as party President, then it'll create an aura for the party."

348.title: Be proactive, need to bring transparency in system: Nadda to Guj party workers
348.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Tuesday asked party workers and elected representatives in Gujarat to "be proactive, pro responsible and pro responsive". "We'll have to bring transparency in system and deliver in transparent manner…this will keep people's faith alive in us," Nadda said while addressing elected representatives from gram to district panchayats, municipal corporations and others.

349.title: Manipur Cabinet approves lifting prohibition partially
349.article_body: To boost the state's revenue, the Manipur Cabinet has decided to partially lift the ban on brewing, consumption and sale of liquor. Prohibition will be lifted from all district headquarters, including Imphal city, tourist destinations and hotels with at least 20 beds, said the state's Tribal Affairs Minister Letpao Haokip. The government is also mulling to export traditionally brewed liquor.

350.title: Public representatives have become a 'laughing stock': VP Dhankhar
350.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday expressed concern over "inappropriate conduct" of public representatives inside Parliament and state Assemblies, adding that they have become a "laughing stock" in front of the public. "Those who should discuss Parliament and Assembly have come on roads," Dhankhar said. "Time has come for a widespread contemplation on this serious situation," he added.

351.title: Massive traffic jam on NH-48 from Kherki toll to G'gram's Hero Honda Chowk
351.article_body: A huge traffic jam was reported on NH-48 from Kherki toll to Hero Honda Chowk towards Delhi on Wednesday morning due to the closure of Jaipur-Delhi carriageway of Hero Honda Chowk flyover on the Delhi-Gurugram Expressway. A five-kilometre-long queue of vehicles was reportedly seen from the junction to the Cloverleaf flyover. The carriageway will remain shut till September 26.

352.title: 40-yr-old teacher, 17-yr-old girl student found hanging in forest in UP
352.article_body: A 40-year-old school teacher and his 17-year-old girl student were found hanging in the forest in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur on Tuesday, police said. The teacher was having an affair with the girl who studied in the same school where he worked, police added. The state of the bodies suggests that both had committed suicide about ten days ago, police stated.

353.title: Activist breaks down at UNGA after appealing for education for Afghan girls
353.article_body: Afghan activist Somaya Faruqi broke down backstage after urging leaders at the United Nations to protect girls' education and women's rights in Afghanistan. On Sunday, the UN urged the Taliban to reopen high schools for Afghan girls that have been shut for a year. The Taliban have barred women from leaving homes without a male relative and a face cover.

354.title: Majority of states want Rahul to be Congress President: Sachin Pilot
354.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said that majority of states want Rahul Gandhi to be Congress President. "Whether he will contest or not, that's his decision, but one thing is for sure, party will get a new President on October 17th," he added. His statement comes after reports claimed that Shashi Tharoor and Ashok Gehlot might contest for Congress chief post.

355.title: Ratan Tata nominated as trustee of PM CARES Fund
355.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata, former Supreme Court judge KT Thomas and former Deputy Lok Sabha Speaker Kariya Munda have been nominated as trustees of the PM CARES Fund, the government said. The announcement came a day after Prime Minister Narendra Modi chaired the board of trustees meeting that was attended by Union Ministers Amit Shah and Nirmala Sitharaman.

356.title: Road ministry issues draft rules for mandatory rear seat belt alarms
356.article_body: Union Ministry of Road, Transport and Highways has issued draft rules to make it mandatory for car makers to install an alarm system for rear seat belts. Recently, former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry died in a car accident and it was reported that while he was sitting in the rear seat, he didn’t have his seat belt on.

357.title: AIIMS doctor transferred for taking money to perform surgery
357.article_body: A doctor from AIIMS, Delhi has been transferred to the National Cancer Institute in Jhajjar after he was found to have taken money from a patient's father for performing a surgery. According to a fact-finding committee's report, Dr KK Roy allegedly asked for ₹34,000 citing the need to procure supplies. Roy said the accusation is not correct.

358.title: He was and will remain king of comedy: Sunil Pal on Raju Srivastava
358.article_body: Comedian Sunil Pal called Raju Srivastava a "brave warrior" who fought till his last breath. "He was, is and will always remain the king of stand-up comedy," Sunil said, adding that his death has left a big void in the entertainment industry. "Raju Srivastava cannot be replaced. His memories will live in our hearts forever," he added.

359.title: US, Canadian warships sail through Taiwan Strait, China condemns action
359.article_body: A US Navy warship and a Canadian frigate made a routine transit through the Taiwan Strait on Tuesday, both countries' militaries confirmed. China condemned the mission, saying its forces "warned" the ships. The transit was reportedly the second in a month by a US Navy ship and the second jointly by the US and Canada since October 2021.

360.title: Engineer arrested for attacking cab driver with knife, assaulting policemen
360.article_body: The Pune Police arrested a 27-year-old software engineer for allegedly attacking a cab driver with a knife after he rejected the trip and also for assaulting two policemen who responded to the situation. The accused attacked one of the policemen with wooden rod and pushed the other. The cab driver sustained injury on stomach but is out of danger.

361.title: Over 300 booked for clash during Ganesh Chaturthi procession in K'taka
361.article_body: More than 300 people have been booked for allegedly attacking the Ganesh Chaturthi procession in Ranebennur of Karnataka's Haveri district, police said. The accused attacked the procession with lethal weapons, triggering violence in the area, police added. "No matter what community they belong to, strict action should be taken against them," JD(S) spokesperson Tanveer Ahmed said.

362.title: Goldman Sachs fires at least 25 bankers in Asia: Report
362.article_body: Goldman Sachs has laid off at least 25 bankers in Asia, Bloomberg News reported. The job cuts impacted junior-level bankers involved in deals in Greater China, the report added. In 2021, Goldman Sachs increased hiring in mainland China and Hong Kong after their financial markets opened to foreign brokerages. The bank's headcount increased to 47,000 by June end.

363.title: BYJU'S shifting focus to profitable growth: CEO tells employees
363.article_body: BYJU'S Founder and CEO, Byju Raveendran, told employees that the company has already started shifting focus towards profitable growth and the idea is to allocate resources effectively to maximise impact. Last week, BYJU'S released audited financial statement for FY21 after a delay of nearly 18 months. The ed-tech firm recorded a ₹4,588 crore loss in FY21, financial results showed.

364.title: Air Force allows PMC to build road on defence land to reach Pune airport
364.article_body: The Air Force has given approval to Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) for building an alternate road to Vimannagar through their land. According to officials, PMC requires 2,350 square meters of defence land to complete the road connecting Pune airport with Vimannagar. "PMC had...constructed the road from both ends...only the Air Force road portion was pending," Pune MP Girish Bapat said.

365.title: Triveni Turbine's stock jumps 6.6% after reports of block deal
365.article_body: Triveni Turbine Limited's shares traded 6.6% higher at ₹243.5 apiece on Wednesday after reports of multiple block deals involving 70.5 million shares changing hands. Triveni Engineering and Industries Ltd, which holds a 21.85% stake in Triveni Turbine, reportedly launched a block deal to sell a stake of 11.85%. The details of the buyers and sellers are yet to be known.

366.title: Actress Bharti Jaffery, daughter of legendary Ashok Kumar, dies
366.article_body: Actress Bharti Jaffrey, daughter of legendary actor Ashok Kumar, passed away on Tuesday after a prolonged illness. Actor Kanwaljit Singh, who is married to Bharti's daughter Anuradha Patel, shared the news of her demise on social media. Bharti Jaffrey starred in movies such as Hazaar Chaurasi Ki Maa, Saans and Daman. She was married to Saeed Jaffrey's brother, Hamid Jaffrey.

367.title: Air India Express incurs net loss for first time in 7 years due to COVID-19
367.article_body: Air India Express, which mainly operates flights between India and the Gulf countries, reported a net loss for the first time in seven years because of the COVID-19 pandemic. The airline posted a net loss of ₹72.33 crore in FY22, against a net profit of ₹98.21 crore in FY21. In FY15, it had posted a net loss of ₹61 crore.

368.title: Raju Srivastava took genre of comedy to new heights with his talent: UP CM
368.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath expressed his grief over the demise of comedian Raju Srivastava. "Raju Srivastava is no more with us. I, on behalf of the people of UP, pray that his soul rests in peace," CM Yogi said. "Raju Srivastava took the genre of comedy…to new heights with his talent and hard work," he stated.

369.title: Residents oppose building of animal hospital in Pune's Hadapsar
369.article_body: Residents of Pune's Hadapsar opposed PMC's decision to build a hospital for animals in the area. "We too want other infrastructure projects in Hadapsar but we only find garbage processing plants and now this animal hospital," said a former NCP corporator. The hospital should be built in a locality where citizens have greater love for stray dogs, said a resident.

370.title: Vehicular movement to be affected in Kurla, police shares diversion routes
370.article_body: The vehicular movement will be hit in Mumbai's Kurla area due to work related to a sewage line and Metro 2 B construction, the Mumbai Traffic Police said. The traffic restrictions will be in place from 12 am on October 1 till 12 am on March 1, 2023. The traffic police shared the list of optional routes for vehicular movement.

371.title: Will use all means to protect Russia if threatened, this is not a bluff: Putin to West
371.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered the country's first mobilisation since WWII, warning that Russia would respond with the might of all its vast arsenal if West continues its "nuclear blackmail". Accusing West of plotting to destroy Russia amid the war in Ukraine, Putin said, "If...threatened, we'll use all available means to protect our people - this isn't a bluff."

372.title: There's no particular reason for its failure: Ronit Roy on 'Liger'
372.article_body: Actor Ronit Roy said he personally doesn't think there's any particular reason behind the box office failure of his recent release, 'Liger'. "You cannot pinpoint something like that. You may hear people say one reason which the majority will agree with, but not every single person thinks like that," he said. Ronit played MMA coach in the Puri Jagannadh directorial.

373.title: Central agencies get their script from BJP office: RJD's Manoj Jha
373.article_body: RJD leader Manoj Kumar Jha on Tuesday extended support to the resolution passed in the West Bengal Assembly against the alleged excessive interference of central agencies. These agencies get their script from the BJP office, Jha stated. He said that according to a report in an English daily, 95% of the cases probed by these agencies are of Opposition leaders.

374.title: Man arrested for vandalising police van, manhandling constable in Pune
374.article_body: A 34-year-old man was arrested for allegedly vandalising a police van and manhandling an on-duty police constable in Pune's Bhosari, police said. "The accused initially hurled a stone at the van...constable was inside...he got down...(accused) manhandled the constable and verbally abused him," police added. "We are probing why he suddenly resorted to vandalising the police vehicle," police stated.

375.title: Mumbai sees 120 new COVID-19 cases, nearly double from day before
375.article_body: Mumbai reported 120 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, nearly double the number seen a day before, when it recorded 66 infections, according to BMC. With one new fatality, the overall death toll reached 19,726, while the cumulative case count climbed to 11,49,235 in the city. The number of active cases stood at 936.

376.title: Raju Srivastava brightened our lives with laughter, his demise is saddening: PM Modi
376.article_body: After the death of comedian Raju Srivastava, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "Raju Srivastava brightened our lives with laughter, humour and positivity." "He leaves us too soon but he will continue to live in hearts of countless people thanks to his rich work over the years. His demise is saddening. Condolences to his family and admirers. Om Shanti," he wrote.

377.title: Central Bank of India stock jumps 15.5% after RBI lifts PCA curb
377.article_body: The shares of Central Bank of India opened 15.5% higher on Wednesday after the Reserve Bank of India removed it from the prompt corrective action (PCA) framework after a period of over five years. The lender was put under the PCA framework in June 2017 because of its high net non-performing assets and low return on assets.

378.title: Constable found dead in Pune CRPF campus, police suspect suicide
378.article_body: A 30-year-old constable of the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) was found dead on the CRPF campus in Pune district's Talegaon Dabhade on Tuesday morning. According to officials, the deceased, identified as Amaresh Kumar Giri, hailed from Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur district. "Primary investigation points to death by suicide. We have launched an investigation," said Inspector Ganesh Jawadwad.

379.title: HK arrests harmonica player at Queen Elizabeth's vigil for sedition
379.article_body: A 43-year-old harmonica player who went to the British consulate in Hong Kong on Monday night to pay tribute to UK Queen Elizabeth II, among scores of mourners, was arrested for alleged sedition. The man reportedly played several songs on his harmonica, including the 'Glory to Hong Kong', the unofficial anthem of pro-democracy protests that rocked the city in 2019.

380.title: Boeing to cut 150 finance jobs in US, may outsource some jobs to India
380.article_body: Planemaker Boeing has said that it will cut 150 finance jobs in the US, with more to come next year and thereafter, in a bid to simplify its corporate structure. The first layoff notices will go out in October. As per a report, the company may outsource some finance and accounting jobs to TCS in India.

381.title: He created his presence in world: Akhilesh on Raju Srivastava's demise
381.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav condoled comedian Raju Srivastava's demise, saying that he created his presence in the world with his talent and hard work. "He came from a poor family…I remember how he wanted to contest from Kanpur when he joined SP," Yadav added. Furthermore, Yadav said that there are very few talented comedians like him.

382.title: Clash between woman, beautician at Delhi salon over eyebrow treatment
382.article_body: Two women were booked by police after a clash erupted between them at a South Delhi salon over "botched-up" eyebrow treatment. The customer, 48, did not like the eyebrow work and an argument broke out between them which escalated into a fight. The customer alleged that she was bitten on her arm while the beautician said her clothes were torn.

383.title: Japanese man sets himself on fire in alleged protest over ex-PM's state funeral
383.article_body: A man, in his 70s, set himself on fire near Japanese Prime Minister's office in an alleged protest against state funeral for former PM Shinzo Abe, reports said. The man reportedly told police he had deliberately doused himself in oil. A letter with words "I strongly oppose it" was found nearby. A police officer trying to extinguish flames was injured.

384.title: Ashutosh Gowariker predicted Chhello Show's Oscars entry: Director Pan Nalin
384.article_body: 'Chhello Show' director Pan Nalin said Ashutosh Gowariker had predicted the film's selection for Oscars five months ago. Remembering Gowariker's reaction after watching the film, Nalin shared, "He said, 'Pack your bags, you guys are going to the Oscars'. This happened five months ago. We laughed then and forgot about it. Aaj yaad aa raha hai (Today I remember it)."

385.title: Samajwadi Party and truth are 2 banks of river, can never meet: CM Yogi
385.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said Samajwadi Party and truth are two banks of a river which can never meet. "It's time [Akhilesh] Yadav learns to speak the truth in the house," CM Yogi added. His remark came as Yadav on Tuesday questioned the health system of UP inside the House on the second day of the Monsoon session.

386.title: Intimacy scenes are not exotic, they're most awkward to shoot: Pooja Bhatt
386.article_body: Pooja Bhatt said Vidya Balan called her after the release of 'Bombay Begums' and expressed how she didn't "cringe" when she saw her kissing on screen. Recalling the compliment, Pooja said that people feel that shooting intimate scenes is "exotic", but she called them the "most awkward thing to shoot". She added, "The challenge is to make it look bearable."

387.title: I want to spend the day with you naked: Singer Adam Levine in message to yoga teacher
387.article_body: After 'Maroon 5' singer Adam Levine was accused of cheating on his wife Behati Prinsloo by a model, a yoga teacher has shared a message that he sent her. "I want to spend the day with you naked," he wrote in the message, according to Alanna Zabel. She said that she taught Levine yoga from 2007 to 2010.

388.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal condoles demise of comedian Raju Srivastava
388.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal expressed his grief at the demise of comedian Raju Srivastava on Wednesday. "Very sad to hear [about] the demise of famous comedian Raju Srivastava ji. My condolences to his family and all...fans in this time of sorrow," Kejriwal tweeted. Srivastava was admitted to AIIMS Delhi on August 10 after suffering a heart attack and collapsing.

389.title: Samantha's manager dismisses reports that she went to US over 'rare skin condition'
389.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu's manager Mahendra has rubbished the rumours that she travelled to the US to undergo treatment for some 'rare skin condition'. Reports claimed her alleged medical condition was the reason for her refraining from public appearances, however, Samantha's manager said, "It's gossip." He did not explain the nature of Samantha's foreign trip.

390.title: RSS head meets Muslim intellectuals to discuss religious inclusivity
390.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat met with several Muslim intellectuals to discuss ways to strengthen religious inclusivity in the country, reported ANI. Former MP Shahid Siddiqui, who attended the meeting, said, "We are concerned that whatever is happening in the country is weakening the religious unity in the country." "Bhagwat belongs to an institution which is followed by many," he added.

391.title: 4 Ukrainian regions to vote in a referendum this week to join Russia
391.article_body: Russia-controlled regions of Ukraine, which include Luhansk, Kherson, Zaporizhzhia and Donetsk, plan to vote this week to become parts of Russia. Dmitry Medvedev, Deputy Chairman of Russia's Security Council, said referendums that fold regions into Russia would make redrawn frontiers "irreversible". Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba denounced vote, saying referendums will change nothing.

392.title: Deeply saddened by passing away of Raju Srivastava: Rajnath Singh
392.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh mourned the loss of comedian Raju Srivastava. The minister tweeted that he is "deeply saddened" to learn about Srivastava's death and extended his condolences to his family and fans. "Apart from being an accomplished artist, he was also a very lively person," the tweet read. The comedian died at the age of 58 in Delhi today.

393.title: Rahul resumes Bharat Jodo Yatra, pays tributes to Sree Narayana Guru
393.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday resumed Bharat Jodo Yatra from Kerala's Madavana. He was accompanied by several party leaders, including Sachin Pilot. On the 14th day of the 'yatra', the Wayanad MP paid floral tributes to social reformer Sree Narayana Guru. The Congress party shared several images of Gandhi mixing with people during the foot march.

394.title: Even poorest of Indian citizen deserves best quality products: Piyush Goyal
394.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said even the poorest citizen of the country deserves the best quality products and the culture of no compromise with quality has to be adopted in the country. "We need to change this mindset of two quality standards for domestic and international markets and must not compromise with quality," Goyal added.

395.title: Great loss to the world of art: Amit Shah on death of Raju Srivastava
395.article_body: After the demise of comedian Raju Srivastava, Home Minister Amit Shah tweeted, "He had a unique style, he impressed everyone with his amazing talent." "His death is a great loss to the world of art. I express my condolences to his family and fans. May God give them the strength to bear this grief," he wrote.

396.title: Fire breaks out at Andhra's paper plate factory; 3, including owner, killed
396.article_body: At least three persons died as a fire broke out at a paper plate manufacturing factory in Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor on Tuesday. The owner of the factory was among the deceased. The other two victims were at the owner's house in the same building to celebrate his son's birthday.  "Investigating is underway...Some of the workers taken to hospital," police said.

397.title: All SC constitution bench hearings to be live-streamed from Sept 27
397.article_body: In a full court meeting on Tuesday, the judges of the Supreme Court unanimously decided to start live-streaming of all constitution bench hearings from September 27. This comes a week after senior advocate Indira Jaising wrote to CJI UU Lalit and other judges requesting live streaming of proceedings of public and constitutional importance.

398.title: Delhi lane of Gurugram's Hero Honda flyover to be closed from Sept 21-26
398.article_body: The Jaipur-Delhi carriageway of the Hero Honda Chowk flyover on the Delhi-Gurugram Expressway will be closed for traffic from September 21 to 26. During this period, commuters going towards Delhi will have to use the NH-48. According to the Gurugram Traffic Police, the lane is being closed to check the status of repair works carried out on the carriageway.

399.title: BJP MLA booked for harassing woman, son for rape: Agra Police
399.article_body: BJP MLA Chotte Lal Verma has been booked for allegedly harassing a woman and his son for allegedly raping her, Agra Police said. MLA has not been accused of rape, police added. The woman claimed that the MLA's son married her in a temple and forced her to abort three times for want of a male child, police further said.

400.title: SpiceJet stock falls 3% after airline sends 80 pilots on unpaid leave
400.article_body: Shares of SpiceJet traded over 3% lower at ₹41.9 apiece at 9:18 am on the BSE on Wednesday after the airline asked 80 of its pilots to go on a three-month leave without pay as a temporary measure to rationalise cost. The pilots, who have been forced to go on leave, are from the Gurugram-headquartered airline's Boeing and Bombardier fleet.

401.title: RBI approves R Gandhi as part-time Chairman of Yes Bank
401.article_body: The RBI has approved the appointment of its Former Deputy Governor, Rama Subramaniam Gandhi, as Non-Executive (Part-Time) Chairman of Yes Bank for three years, a regulatory filing said. Gandhi had a three-year secondment to the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI). He is a financial sector policy advisor who worked with investors and fintech companies.

402.title: Pak PM accused of treason for consulting Nawaz Sharif over new Army chief
402.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has been accused of committing treason for consulting his 'fugitive' elder brother and ex-PM Nawaz Sharif on the appointment of the new Army chief. A resolution was passed by the Punjab state assembly in this regard, seeking action against the PM. Shehbaz had met his brother while he was in London for Queen Elizabeth II's funeral.

403.title: Owaisi asks why is Jamia Masjid shut, Srinagar Police says it's not
403.article_body: After AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi asked Jammu & Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha why Srinagar's Jamia Masjid is shut every Friday, the police refuted the claim saying it is fully open. It was closed only on three occasions post-COVID, owing to inputs of terror attack and law and order situation, tweeted Srinagar Police. "Staying far is no excuse of ignorance," it added.
